title: Trying to identify this font
content:
Hi there. I was referred to this forum by a friend; I’m trying to find a certain font.

You know how whenever you went to the skating rink or the carnival, the snackbars would always have backlit signs with plastic letters that looked like this:

[http://i304.photobucket.com/albums/nn191/codytebaldi/menuboard.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052605/http:/i304.photobucket.com/albums/nn191/codytebaldi/menuboard.jpg "http://i304.photobucket.com/albums/nn191/codytebaldi/menuboard.jpg")

Is there a font I could obtain which is identical to this lettering style? Helvetica looks close, but I’m not sure it’s a 100% match. Perhaps someone a bit more studied in typefaces could identify the font?

Thanks in advance...

 [‹ India style typo](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052605/http:/www.typophile.com/node/49337 "Go to previous forum topic") [Open source layout/word processing software with support for Opentype? ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052605/http:/www.typophile.com/node/48354 "Go to next forum topic")
author: codytebaldi

comments.content: I don’t think you’ll find a digital font that matches this perfectly as the forms were probably created specifically for these letters. Helvetica comes close, as would many in [this list](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052605/http:/fontfeed.com/archives/helvetica-and-alternatives-to-helvetica/).

Don’t know if this would be any better, but look at James Montalbano’s [Now Playing](http://web.archive.org/web/20081025052605/http:/www.terminaldesign.com/fonts/characters/?ID=175), based on plastic marquee lettering.
